description.zh-cn: 明朝开国功臣，最后一任中书省丞相。后因被疑叛乱，在胡惟庸案中遭明太祖朱元璋处死。
description.en: A founding official of the Ming Dynasty and the last Chancellor of the Secretariat. He was later executed by Emperor Taizu of Ming (Zhu Yuanzhang) during the Hu Weiyong case on suspicion of rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 明朝的开国皇帝。他在胡惟庸案后废除了中国的丞相制度。
description.en: The founding emperor of the Ming Dynasty. He abolished the chancellorship in China after the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝洪武年间发生的重大政治案件，因丞相胡惟庸被控谋反引起，导致大量功臣和官员被牵连诛杀，并直接促成明太祖废除丞相制度。
description.en: A major political case during the Hongwu era of the Ming Dynasty, triggered by accusations of rebellion against Chancellor Hu Weiyong. It led to the purge and execution of a large number of officials and culminated in Emperor Taizu's abolition of the chancellorship.

description.zh-cn: 明朝初年的中央最高行政机构，负责总理全国政务，后因胡惟庸案被明太祖废除。
description.en: The highest central administrative body in the early Ming Dynasty, responsible for managing national government affairs. It was abolished by Emperor Taizu after the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代辅佐君主的最高行政长官职位。明朝的丞相制度在胡惟庸案后被朱元璋废除。
description.en: The highest administrative official who served as the head of government under the emperor in imperial China. The position was abolished in the Ming Dynasty by Emperor Taizu after the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸和李善长的家乡，今属安徽省。
description.en: The hometown of Hu Weiyong and Li Shanchang, now part of Anhui Province.

description.zh-cn: 明朝初期的首都，胡惟庸在此地被处死。
description.en: The capital city in the early Ming Dynasty, where Hu Weiyong was executed.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国功臣，官至太师，与胡惟庸同乡并有姻亲关系，后受胡惟庸案牵连被杀。
description.en: A founding official of the Ming Dynasty who served as Grand Preceptor. He was a fellow townsman and related by marriage to Hu Weiyong, and was later implicated and killed in the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝官员，曾与胡惟庸一同担任中书省丞相，后在胡惟庸案爆发前夕被朱元璋赐死。
description.en: An official of the Ming Dynasty who served as a Chancellor of the Secretariat alongside Hu Weiyong. He was ordered to commit suicide by Emperor Taizu shortly before the Hu Weiyong case erupted.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国功臣、军事将领，对胡惟庸的专权极为厌恶并向朱元璋密报。
description.en: A founding official and military general of the Ming Dynasty who deeply detested Hu Weiyong's abuse of power and secretly reported it to Emperor Taizu.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国功臣、政治家，曾向朱元璋指出胡惟庸不适合担任丞相，其死因被怀疑与胡惟庸有关。
description.en: A founding official and statesman of the Ming Dynasty who had advised Emperor Taizu that Hu Weiyong was unfit to be chancellor. His death was suspected to be related to Hu Weiyong.

description.zh-cn: 明朝中丞，初与胡惟庸同谋，后告发其阴谋，但最终仍被处死。
description.en: A Censor-in-chief of the Ming Dynasty who initially conspired with Hu Weiyong but later exposed the plot, yet was still executed.

description.zh-cn: 明朝御史大夫，参与胡惟庸谋反，后一同被诛杀。
description.en: A Grand Censor of the Ming Dynasty who participated in Hu Weiyong's rebellion and was subsequently executed along with him.

description.zh-cn: 明朝学士，曾弹劾胡惟庸但差点遭祸。
description.en: A scholar of the Ming Dynasty who impeached Hu Weiyong and nearly fell into disaster as a result.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国功臣，封吉安侯，后卷入胡惟庸谋反案。
description.en: A founding official of the Ming Dynasty, enfeoffed as Marquis of Ji'an, who later became involved in Hu Weiyong's rebellion case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国功臣，封平凉侯，后卷入胡惟庸谋反案。
description.en: A founding official of the Ming Dynasty, enfeoffed as Marquis of Pingliang, who later became involved in Hu Weiyong's rebellion case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝明州卫指挥，受胡惟庸派遣联络日本。
description.en: A commander of the Mingzhou Guard in the Ming Dynasty, sent by Hu Weiyong to contact Japan.

description.zh-cn: 元朝旧臣，受胡惟庸派遣联络北元。
description.en: A former official of the Yuan Dynasty, sent by Hu Weiyong to contact the Northern Yuan.

description.zh-cn: 明朝御史中丞，曾告发胡惟庸的阴谋。
description.en: A Censor-in-chief of the Ming Dynasty who exposed Hu Weiyong's conspiracy.

description.zh-cn: 东亚岛国，胡惟庸曾试图联络其出兵作为外援。
description.en: An East Asian island nation that Hu Weiyong attempted to contact for military aid as external support for his rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 元朝被明朝驱逐出中原后在蒙古高原建立的政权，胡惟庸曾向其请求出兵。
description.en: The regime established on the Mongolian Plateau by the Yuan Dynasty after being expelled from the Central Plains by the Ming Dynasty. Hu Weiyong requested troops from them.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代掌管宗庙祭祀礼仪的机构，胡惟庸曾在此任职。
description.en: An institution in imperial China responsible for rites and ceremonies of imperial ancestral worship, where Hu Weiyong once served.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上的朝代，由朱元璋于1368年建立。
description.en: A dynasty in Chinese history, founded by Zhu Yuanzhang in 1368.

description.zh-cn: 1355年（龙凤元年），胡惟庸在和州投奔朱元璋，成为其下属。
description.en: In 1355, Hu Weiyong joined Zhu Yuanzhang in Hezhou, becoming his subordinate.

description.zh-cn: 因被控图谋叛乱，胡惟庸被明太祖朱元璋下令处死，并夷三族。
description.en: Accused of plotting a rebellion, Hu Weiyong was ordered to be executed by Emperor Taizu of Ming (Zhu Yuanzhang), and his entire clan was exterminated.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸被指控的谋反行为是胡惟庸案爆发的直接原因。
description.en: Hu Weiyong's alleged rebellion was the direct cause of the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸案发生后，明太祖朱元璋废除了中书省。
description.en: After the Hu Weiyong case, Emperor Taizu of Ming (Zhu Yuanzhang) abolished the Secretariat.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸案的直接政治后果是明太祖朱元璋决定永久废除丞相职位。
description.en: The direct political consequence of the Hu Weiyong case was Emperor Taizu's decision to permanently abolish the position of Chancellor.

description.zh-cn: 徐达极其厌恶胡惟庸，并向朱元璋密报其不适合任相。
description.en: Xu Da deeply disliked Hu Weiyong and secretly reported to Emperor Taizu that he was unfit to be chancellor.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸曾试图收买徐达的守门人来谋害徐达，但阴谋败露。
description.en: Hu Weiyong attempted to bribe Xu Da's gatekeeper to assassinate him, but the plot was exposed.

description.zh-cn: 刘基曾向朱元璋指出胡惟庸的缺点，认为任用他好比用劣马驾车，必然会坏事。
description.en: Liu Ji had pointed out Hu Weiyong's shortcomings to Emperor Taizu, comparing his appointment to harnessing a poor horse that would surely wreck the cart.

description.zh-cn: 刘基病重期间，胡惟庸奉命带医生探视，刘基服药后不久去世，时人因此怀疑胡惟庸下毒害死了刘基。
description.en: During Liu Ji's severe illness, Hu Weiyong was ordered to bring a doctor to see him. Liu Ji died shortly after taking the medicine, leading to suspicion that Hu Weiyong had poisoned him.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸与李善长为同乡，并结成姻亲，胡惟庸在谋反时曾积极拉拢李善长。
description.en: Hu Weiyong and Li Shanchang were from the same hometown and became relatives by marriage. Hu Weiyong actively tried to win over Li Shanchang for his rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 1380年正月，涂节在看到事泄的风险后，告发了胡惟庸的谋反计划。
description.en: In the first month of 1380, seeing the risk of exposure, Tu Jie reported Hu Weiyong's rebellion plot.

description.zh-cn: 1380年正月，商暠也告发了胡惟庸的阴谋。
description.en: In the first month of 1380, Shang Gao also exposed Hu Weiyong's conspiracy.

description.zh-cn: 学士吴伯宗曾弹劾胡惟庸，但差点因此招来杀身之祸。
description.en: The scholar Wu Bozong once impeached Hu Weiyong, but nearly brought disaster upon himself as a result.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸利用陆仲亨害怕被朱元璋惩罚的心理，将其拉拢为同党，密谋起事。
description.en: Hu Weiyong exploited Lu Zhongheng's fear of punishment from Emperor Taizu to bring him into his conspiracy.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸利用费聚害怕被朱元璋惩罚的心理，将其拉拢为同党，密谋起事。
description.en: Hu Weiyong exploited Fei Ju's fear of punishment from Emperor Taizu to bring him into his conspiracy.

description.zh-cn: 陈宁是胡惟庸谋反集团的核心成员之一。
description.en: Chen Ning was one of the core members of Hu Weiyong's rebellion clique.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸派明州卫指挥林贤出海，联络日本，请求其出兵作为谋反的外应。
description.en: Hu Weiyong sent Mingzhou Guard commander Lin Xian to sea to contact Japan and request troops as external support for his rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸派元朝旧臣封绩向北元称臣，请求其出兵作为谋反的外应。
description.en: Hu Weiyong sent former Yuan official Feng Ji to pledge allegiance to the Northern Yuan and request troops as external support for his rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 在胡惟庸案爆发前夕，因中书省瞒报占城国入贡之事，朱元璋赐死汪广洋。
description.en: On the eve of the Hu Weiyong case, Emperor Taizu ordered Wang Guangyang to commit suicide because the Secretariat had concealed the tribute from Champa.

description.zh-cn: 受胡惟庸派遣，出海联络日本，约定出兵。
description.en: Under Hu Weiyong's orders, he went to sea to contact Japan and arrange for troops to be sent.

description.zh-cn: 受胡惟庸派遣，致书北元请求出兵。
description.en: Under Hu Weiyong's orders, he sent a letter to the Northern Yuan requesting troops.
